IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO FACILITATE AND PROMOTE PHILANTHROPY THROUGH DONOR ADVISED FUNDS
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND FACILITATES AND PROMOTES CHARITABLE GIVING TO SECTARIAN AND NONSECTARIAN ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH DONOR-ADVISED FUNDS AND PROVIDES SUPPORT TO JEWISH ORGANIZATIONS IN NEW YORK. JCF ENABLES INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR PHILANTHROPIC GOALS SIMPLY AND EFFECTIVELY, WITH FULL CONFIDENTIALITY. JCF ESTABLISHED THREE DISTINCT TYPES OF PHILANTHROPIC FUNDS - UNDESIGNATED FUNDS: WHERE THE PRIVILEGE OF GRANT RECOMMENDATION IS GIVEN TO THE DONOR (AND HIS OR HER DESIGNEES) AND THE DISTRIBUTION OF PRINCIPAL AND INCOME IS GOVERNED BY JCF GRANT GUIDELINES. GRANT MAKING IS SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE. DESIGNATED FUNDS: WHERE THE BENEFICIARIES AND THE SCHEDULE OF DISTRIBUTIONS ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT AND ARE APPROVED BY THE CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE BEFORE JCF ACCEPTS THE GIFT. ENDOWMENT FUNDS: IN WHICH THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE HAVE THE RESPONSIBILITY
IRS990.Description: JCF'S PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS TO SERVE DONORS WHO HAVE ENTRUSTED IT WITH THEIR CHARITABLE DOLLARS. JCF TAKES THIS RESPONSIBILITY VERY SERIOUSLY AND IS COMMITTED TO TREATING ITS DONORS WITH THE UTMOST INTEGRITY AND RESPECT. JCF HANDLES ALL THE ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES FOR EACH DONOR-ADVISED FUND AND PROVIDES DONORS WITH REGULAR REPORTS ON CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS,INVESTMENT INCOME, FUND BALANCE AND ALL OTHER ACTIVITY RELATED TO THE FUND. JCF HONORS ITS COMMITMENT TO DONORS BY PROVIDING SERVICES THAT MAKE THEIR CHARITABLE GIVING ADMINISTRATIVELY EFFICIENT, ECONOMICALLY ADVANTAGEOUS, AND PERSONALLY REWARDING. THESE INCLUDE SIMPLIFYING THE GRANT-MAKING PROCESS SO THAT DONOR CONTRIBUTIONS FLOW QUICKLY AND EASILY IN THE CHARITABLE STREAM, OFFERING A CHOICE OF INVESTMENT VEHICLES DESIGNED TO HELP DONORS' CHARITABLE DOLLARS GROW, KEEPING DONORS INFORMED ABOUT CHANGING TAX LAWS THAT MAY IMPACT THEIR CHARITABLE GIVING, SUGGESTING WAYS FOR DONORS TO INCORPORATE PHILANTHROPY INTO THEIR ESTATE AND GIFT PLANNING, EDUCATING DONORS ABOUT GRANT-MAKING STRATEGIES AND COMMUNAL PHILANTHROPIC RESOURCES, SAFEGUARDING DONOR CONFIDENTIALITY, AND FACILITATING INTERGENERATIONAL PHILANTHROPY.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Explanation: The Jewish Communal Fund Endowment Fund renamed the Special Gifts Fund, is a fund from which grants are made to support projects and/or organizations in the Jewish community recommended by UJA-Federation of New York. The Fund's spending policy is 7% of the twelve preceding calendar quarters rolling average of the fund balance. Grant proposals are submitted by UJA-Federation to the Jewish Communal Fund Special Gifts Committee based on the following criteria: Proposals can be for both capital and programmatic purposes. Proposals should have a high impact on the Jewish community, be accompanied by agency budgets, and organizations receiving multi-year grants must provide annual status updates. Projects selected by the Special Gifts Fund Committee are submitted to the Jewish Communal Fund Board of Trustees for approval.

JCF is subject to the provisions of the Financial Accounting Standards Board's Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Topic 740-10-05, relating to accounting and reporting for uncertainty in income taxes. JCF is subject to potential excise taxes relating to its investment activities; however, because of JCF's general tax-exempt status, ASC Topic 740-10-05 has not had, and is not expected to have, a material impact on JCF's financial statements. JCF is no longer subject to examination by federal or state tax authorities for fiscal years prior to 2010.

Form990ScheduleFPartV.Explanation: Procedures for Foreign Grant making Jewish Communal Fund asks all potential grantees for documentation to substantiate that they would qualify as the equivalent of a U.S. charity. THE FOREIGN GRANT RECIPIENTS WERE ALL VERIFIED THROUGH GUIDESTAR AND THE IRS WEBSITE. EACH ENTITY IS ASKED TO COMPLETE AN INFORMATIONAL FORM AND PROVIDE THEIR DETERMINATION LETTER OR LETTER OF INTENT FROM THE IRS.
While Jewish Communal Fund did own this type of investment, the threshold for filing a 5471 form was not met, and therefore no such filing was necessary.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: IT IS JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND'S POLICY TO DISBURSE UNRESTRICTED GENERAL PURPOSE GRANTS TO QUALIFIED ORGANIZATIONS AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE A GRANT MONITORING POLICY. JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND DOES VERIFY THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS OF POTENTIAL GRANT RECIPIENTS PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: This is a supplemental nonqualified retirement plan for the Executive Vice President.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AND FULL BOARD REVIEW AND APPROVE THE FORM 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY REQUIRING ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT TO COMPLETE THE RELATED PARTIES AND ETHICAL GUIDELINES DOCUMENTS ANNUALLY. THE COMPLETED DOCUMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, WHICH CONSISTS OF BOARD MEMBERS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE USES COMPARABLE DATA FROM SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS TO DETERMINE CURRENT COMPENSATION LEVELS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE PRESENTED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR FINAL APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: JCF MAKES AVAILABLE ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON ITS WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST. IT DOES NOT MAKE AVAILABLE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE LINE 6 AND 7A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND HAS ONE MEMBER. THE MEMBER PARTICIPATES IN THE ELECTION OF TRUSTEES AND HAS THE AUTHORITY TO TERMINATE TRUSTEES WITH CAUSE AT ANY TIME.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS IN COMMON
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING THE FISCAL-YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2013, THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND ("JCF") HAD CERTAIN BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS IN COMMON WITH THE UNITED JEWISH APPEAL FEDERATION OF JEWISH PHILANTHROPIES OF NEW YORK, INC. STAVIS TRUSTEE TRUSTEE
